speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Is she to be buried in Christian burial,

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: when she willfully seeks her own salvation?

speaker: OTHER
text: I tell thee she is. Therefore make her grave

speaker: OTHER
text: straight. The crowner hath sat on her and finds it

speaker: OTHER
text: Christian burial.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: How can that be, unless she drowned

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: herself in her own defense?

speaker: OTHER
text: Why, ’tis found so.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: It must be se offendendo; it cannot be

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: else. For here lies the point: if I drown myself

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: wittingly, it argues an act, and an act hath three

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: branches—it is to act, to do, to perform. Argal, she

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: drowned herself wittingly.

speaker: OTHER
text: Nay, but hear you, goodman delver—

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Give me leave. Here lies the water;

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: good. Here stands the man; good. If the man go to

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: this water and drown himself, it is (will he, nill he)

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: he goes; mark you that. But if the water come to him

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: and drown him, he drowns not himself. Argal, he

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: that is not guilty of his own death shortens not his

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: own life.

speaker: OTHER
text: But is this law?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Ay, marry, is ’t—crowner’s ’quest law.

speaker: OTHER
text: Will you ha’ the truth on ’t? If this had not been

speaker: OTHER
text: a gentlewoman, she should have been buried out o’

speaker: OTHER
text: Christian burial.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Why, there thou sayst. And the more

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: pity that great folk should have count’nance in this

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: world to drown or hang themselves more than

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: their even-Christian. Come, my spade. There is no

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: ancient gentlemen but gard’ners, ditchers, and

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: grave-makers. They hold up Adam’s profession.

speaker: OTHER
text: Was he a gentleman?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: He was the first that ever bore arms.

speaker: OTHER
text: Why, he had none.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: What, art a heathen? How dost thou

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: understand the scripture? The scripture says Adam

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: digged. Could he dig without arms? I’ll put another

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: question to thee. If thou answerest me not to the

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: purpose, confess thyself—

speaker: OTHER
text: Go to!

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: What is he that builds stronger than

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: either the mason, the shipwright, or the carpenter?

speaker: OTHER
text: The gallows-maker; for that frame outlives a

speaker: OTHER
text: thousand tenants.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: I like thy wit well, in good faith. The

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: gallows does well. But how does it well? It does

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: well to those that do ill. Now, thou dost ill to say the

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: gallows is built stronger than the church. Argal, the

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: gallows may do well to thee. To ’t again, come.

speaker: OTHER
text: “Who builds stronger than a mason, a shipwright,

speaker: OTHER
text: or a carpenter?”

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Ay, tell me that, and unyoke.

speaker: OTHER
text: Marry, now I can tell.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: To ’t.

speaker: OTHER
text: Mass, I cannot tell.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Cudgel thy brains no more about it,

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: for your dull ass will not mend his pace with

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: beating. And, when you are asked this question

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: next, say “a grave-maker.” The houses he makes

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: lasts till doomsday. Go, get thee in, and fetch me a

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: stoup of liquor.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Has this fellow no feeling of his business? He

speaker: HAMLET
text: sings in grave-making.

speaker: HORATIO
text: Custom hath made it in him a property of

speaker: HORATIO
text: easiness.

speaker: HAMLET
text: ’Tis e’en so. The hand of little employment

speaker: HAMLET
text: hath the daintier sense.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text:
But
               
              age
               
              with
               
              his
               
              stealing
               
              steps

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text:
Hath
               
              clawed
               
              me
               
              in
               
              his
               
              clutch
              ,

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text:
And
               
              hath
               
              shipped
               
              me
               
              into
               
              the
               
              land
              ,

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text:
As
               
              if
               
              I
               
              had
               
              never
               
              been
               
              such
              .

speaker: HAMLET
text: That skull had a tongue in it and could sing

speaker: HAMLET
text: once. How the knave jowls it to the ground as if

speaker: HAMLET
text: ’twere Cain’s jawbone, that did the first murder!

speaker: HAMLET
text: This might be the pate of a politician which this ass

speaker: HAMLET
text: now o’erreaches, one that would circumvent God,

speaker: HAMLET
text: might it not?

speaker: HORATIO
text: It might, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Or of a courtier, which could say “Good

speaker: HAMLET
text: morrow, sweet lord! How dost thou, sweet lord?”

speaker: HAMLET
text: This might be my Lord Such-a-one that praised my

speaker: HAMLET
text: Lord Such-a-one’s horse when he went to beg it,

speaker: HAMLET
text: might it not?

speaker: HORATIO
text: Ay, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Why, e’en so. And now my Lady Worm’s,

speaker: HAMLET
text: chapless and knocked about the mazard with a

speaker: HAMLET
text: sexton’s spade. Here’s fine revolution, an we had

speaker: HAMLET
text: the trick to see ’t. Did these bones cost no more the

speaker: HAMLET
text: breeding but to play at loggets with them? Mine

speaker: HAMLET
text: ache to think on ’t.

text:

O

For

speaker: HAMLET
text: There’s another. Why may not that be the

speaker: HAMLET
text: skull of a lawyer? Where be his quiddities now, his

speaker: HAMLET
text: quillities, his cases, his tenures, and his tricks? Why

speaker: HAMLET
text: does he suffer this mad knave now to knock him

speaker: HAMLET
text: about the sconce with a dirty shovel and will not tell

speaker: HAMLET
text: him of his action of battery? Hum, this fellow might

speaker: HAMLET
text: be in ’s time a great buyer of land, with his statutes,

speaker: HAMLET
text: his recognizances, his fines, his double vouchers,

speaker: HAMLET
text: his recoveries. Is this the fine of his fines and the

speaker: HAMLET
text: recovery of his recoveries, to have his fine pate full

speaker: HAMLET
text: of fine dirt? Will his vouchers vouch him no more

speaker: HAMLET
text: of his purchases, and double ones too, than the

speaker: HAMLET
text: length and breadth of a pair of indentures? The very

speaker: HAMLET
text: conveyances of his lands will scarcely lie in this box,

speaker: HAMLET
text: and must th’ inheritor himself have no more, ha?

speaker: HORATIO
text: Not a jot more, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Is not parchment made of sheepskins?

speaker: HORATIO
text: Ay, my lord, and of calves’ skins too.

speaker: HAMLET
text: They are sheep and calves which seek out

speaker: HAMLET
text: assurance in that. I will speak to this fellow.—

speaker: HAMLET
text: Whose grave’s this, sirrah?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Mine, sir.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text:
O
              ,

speaker: HAMLET
text: I think it be thine indeed, for thou liest in ’t.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: You lie out on ’t, sir, and therefore ’tis

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: not yours. For my part, I do not lie in ’t, yet it is

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: mine.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Thou dost lie in ’t, to be in ’t and say it is thine.

speaker: HAMLET
text: ’Tis for the dead, not for the quick; therefore thou

speaker: HAMLET
text: liest.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: ’Tis a quick lie, sir; ’twill away again

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: from me to you.

speaker: HAMLET
text: What man dost thou dig it for?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: For no man, sir.

speaker: HAMLET
text: What woman then?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: For none, neither.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Who is to be buried in ’t?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: One that was a woman, sir, but, rest

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: her soul, she’s dead.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How absolute the knave is! We must speak by

speaker: HAMLET
text: the card, or equivocation will undo us. By the

speaker: HAMLET
text: Lord, Horatio, this three years I have took note of

speaker: HAMLET
text: it: the age is grown so picked that the toe of the

speaker: HAMLET
text: peasant comes so near the heel of the courtier, he

speaker: HAMLET
text: galls his kibe.—How long hast thou been

speaker: HAMLET
text: grave-maker?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Of all the days i’ th’ year, I came to ’t

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: that day that our last King Hamlet overcame

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Fortinbras.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How long is that since?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Cannot you tell that? Every fool can

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: tell that. It was that very day that young Hamlet

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: was born—he that is mad, and sent into England.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Ay, marry, why was he sent into England?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Why, because he was mad. He shall

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: recover his wits there. Or if he do not, ’tis no great

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: matter there.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Why?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: ’Twill not be seen in him there. There

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: the men are as mad as he.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How came he mad?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Very strangely, they say.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How “strangely”?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Faith, e’en with losing his wits.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Upon what ground?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Why, here in Denmark. I have been

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: sexton here, man and boy, thirty years.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How long will a man lie i’ th’ earth ere he rot?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Faith, if he be not rotten before he die

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: (as we have many pocky corses nowadays that will

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: scarce hold the laying in), he will last you some

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: eight year or nine year. A tanner will last you nine

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: year.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Why he more than another?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: trade that he will keep out water a great while; and

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: your water is a sore decayer of your whoreson dead

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: body. Here’s a skull now hath lien you i’ th’ earth

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: three-and-twenty years.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Whose was it?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: A whoreson mad fellow’s it was.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: Whose do you think it was?

speaker: HAMLET
text: Nay, I know not.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: A pestilence on him for a mad rogue!

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: He poured a flagon of Rhenish on my head once.

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: This same skull, sir, was, sir, Yorick’s skull, the

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: King’s jester.

speaker: HAMLET
text: This?

speaker: GRAVEDIGGER
text: E’en that.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Let me see. Alas, poor

speaker: HAMLET
text: Yorick! I knew him, Horatio—a fellow of infinite

speaker: HAMLET
text: jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath bore me on his

speaker: HAMLET
text: back a thousand times, and now how abhorred in

speaker: HAMLET
text: my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it. Here hung

speaker: HAMLET
text: those lips that I have kissed I know not how oft.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Where be your gibes now? your gambols? your

speaker: HAMLET
text: songs? your flashes of merriment that were wont to

speaker: HAMLET
text: set the table on a roar? Not one now to mock your

speaker: HAMLET
text: own grinning? Quite chapfallen? Now get you to my

speaker: HAMLET
text: lady’s chamber, and tell her, let her paint an inch

speaker: HAMLET
text: thick, to this favor she must come. Make her laugh

speaker: HAMLET
text: at that.—Prithee, Horatio, tell me one thing.

speaker: HORATIO
text: What’s that, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text: Dost thou think Alexander looked o’ this

speaker: HAMLET
text: fashion i’ th’ earth?

speaker: HORATIO
text: E’en so.

speaker: HAMLET
text: And smelt so? Pah!

speaker: HORATIO
text: E’en so, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: To what base uses we may return, Horatio!

speaker: HAMLET
text: Why may not imagination trace the noble dust of

speaker: HAMLET
text: Alexander till he find it stopping a bunghole?

speaker: HORATIO
text: ’Twere to consider too curiously to consider

speaker: HORATIO
text: so.

speaker: HAMLET
text: No, faith, not a jot; but to follow him thither,

speaker: HAMLET
text: with modesty enough and likelihood to lead it, as

speaker: HAMLET
text: thus: Alexander died, Alexander was buried, Alexander

speaker: HAMLET
text: returneth to dust; the dust is earth; of earth

speaker: HAMLET
text: we make loam; and why of that loam whereto he

speaker: HAMLET
text: was converted might they not stop a beer barrel?
